study.description: A Study is a container for a sequencing investigation that may comprise multiple experiments. The Study has an overall goal, but is otherwise minimally defined in the SRA.  A Study is composed of a descriptor, zero or more experiments, and zero or more analyses. The submitter may decorate the Study with web links and properties.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for a study. This is used to link experiments to the study.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the study as would be used in a publication.

fields.name: study_type
fields.description: The STUDY_TYPE presents a controlled vocabulary for expressing the overall purpose of the study.

fields.name: new_study_type
fields.description: Optional if 'study_type' is not 'other'. To propose a new term, select Other and enter a new study type.

fields.name: study_abstract
fields.description: Briefly describes the goals, purpose, and scope of the Study.  This need not be listed if it can be inherited from a referenced publication.

experiment.description: An experiment object serves as a metadata record encapsulating essential details about a sequencing experiment, including the experimental design, sequencing type, and relevant parameters. This information enhances the interpretation and contextual understanding of nucleotide sequences submitted to the archive.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each experiment. This is used to link runs to experiments.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Short text that can be used to call out experiment records in searches or in displays. This element is technically optional but should be used for all new records.

fields.name: study_alias
fields.description: Identifies the parent study. (From study metadata)

fields.name: sample_alias
fields.description: (From sample metadata)

fields.name: design_description
fields.description: Goal and setup of the individual library including library was constructed.

fields.name: library_name
fields.description: The submitter's name for this library.

fields.name: library_strategy
fields.description: Sequencing technique intended for this library.

fields.name: library_source
fields.description: The LIBRARY_SOURCE specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced.

fields.name: library_selection
fields.description: Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation

fields.name: library_layout
fields.description: LIBRARY_LAYOUT specifies whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads. In the case of paired reads, information about the relative distance and orientation is specified.

fields.name: insert_size
fields.description: Insert size for paired reads

fields.name: library_construction_protocol
fields.description: Free form text describing the protocol by which the sequencing library was constructed.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The PLATFORM record selects which sequencing platform and platform-specific runtime parameters. This will be determined by the Center. optional if 'instrument_model' is provided.

fields.name: instrument_model
fields.description: Model of the sequencing instrument.

run.description: A run contains a group of reads generated for a particular experiment.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each run.

fields.name: experiment_alias
fields.description: From_experiment_metadata

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: The name or relative pathname of a run data file.

fields.name: file_format
fields.description: The run data file model.

sample.description: A Sample defines an isolate of sequenceable material upon which sequencing experiments can be based.  The Sample object may be a surrogate for taxonomy accession or an anonymized individual identifier.  Or, it may fully specify provenance and isolation method of the starting material.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Unique identificator for each sample.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.

fields.name: taxon_id
fields.description: NCBI Taxonomy Identifier.  This is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.

fields.name: sample_description
fields.description: Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.

fields.name: number_of_inoculated_individuals
fields.description: Number of host individuals inoculated for the experiment.

fields.name: trophic_level
fields.description: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

fields.name: observed_biotic_relationship
fields.description: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with. E.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y. The target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object.

fields.name: known_pathogenicity
fields.description: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

fields.name: relationship_to_oxygen
fields.description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

fields.name: propagation
fields.description: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

fields.name: sample_collection_device
fields.description: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

fields.name: sample_collection_method
fields.description: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

fields.name: project_name
fields.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

fields.name: frequency_of_cooking
fields.description: The number of times a meal is cooked per week

fields.name: ploidy
fields.description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

fields.name: number_of_replicons
fields.description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

fields.name: extrachromosomal_elements
fields.description: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

fields.name: estimated_size
fields.description: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

fields.name: target_gene
fields.description: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

fields.name: target_subfragment
fields.description: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

fields.name: multiplex_identifiers
fields.description: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

fields.name: sequence_quality_check
fields.description: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

fields.name: chimera_check_software
fields.description: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

fields.name: relevant_electronic_resources
fields.description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

fields.name: relevant_standard_operating_procedures
fields.description: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

fields.name: collection_date
fields.description: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.
fields.regex: (^[12][0-9]{3}(-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?(/[0-9]{4}(-[0-9]{2}(-[0-9]{2}(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?)?$)|(^not applicable$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$)

fields.name: altitude
fields.description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.
fields.regex: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$))

fields.name: geographic_location_latitude
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
fields.regex: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not applicable$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$)

fields.name: geographic_location_longitude
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
fields.regex: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not applicable$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$)

fields.name: geographic_location_region_and_locality
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

fields.name: broadscale_environmental_context
fields.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

fields.name: local_environmental_context
fields.description: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

fields.name: environmental_medium
fields.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

fields.name: elevation
fields.description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.
fields.regex: ([+-]?(0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$))

fields.name: sampling_time_outside
fields.description: The recent and long term history of outside sampling

fields.name: temperature_outside_house
fields.description: The recorded temperature value at sampling time outside

fields.name: train_station_collection_location
fields.description: The train station collection location

fields.name: train_stop_collection_location
fields.description: The train stop collection location

fields.name: surface_material
fields.description: surface materials at the point of sampling

fields.name: surfaceair_contaminant
fields.description: contaminant identified on surface

fields.name: indoor_surface
fields.description: type of indoor surface

fields.name: indoor_space
fields.description: a distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

fields.name: filter_type
fields.description: a device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants

fields.name: heating_and_cooling_system_type
fields.description: methods of conditioning or heating a room or building

fields.name: substructure_type
fields.description: the substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level

fields.name: light_type
fields.description: application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light

fields.name: building_setting
fields.description: a location (geography) where a building is set

fields.name: building_occupancy_type
fields.description: the primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used

fields.name: space_typical_state
fields.description: customary or normal state of the space

fields.name: typical_occupant_density
fields.description: customary or normal density of occupants

fields.name: occupancy_at_sampling
fields.description: number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space

fields.name: occupant_density_at_sampling
fields.description: average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage

fields.name: ventilation_type
fields.description: The intentional movement of air from outside a building to the inside through forced or natural movement of air

fields.name: rooms_that_are_on_the_same_hallway
fields.description: List of room(s) (room number, room name) located in the same hallway as sampling room

fields.name: wall_surface_treatment
fields.description: The surface treatment of interior wall

fields.name: wall_area
fields.description: The total area of the sampled room's walls

fields.name: elevator_count
fields.description: The number of elevators within the built structure

fields.name: floor_area
fields.description: The area of the floor space within the room

fields.name: furniture
fields.description: The types of furniture present in the sampled room

fields.name: water_feature_type
fields.description: The type of water feature present within the building being sampled

fields.name: room_door_distance
fields.description: Distance between doors (meters) in the hallway between the sampling room and adjacent rooms

fields.name: room_type
fields.description: The main purpose or activity of the sampling room. A room is any distinguishable space within a structure

fields.name: window_location
fields.description: The relative location of the window within the room

fields.name: ceiling_type
fields.description: The type of ceiling according to the ceiling's appearance or construction

fields.name: door_direction_of_opening
fields.description: The direction the door opens

fields.name: exposed_pipes
fields.description: The number of exposed pipes in the room

fields.name: wall_height
fields.description: The average height of the walls in the sampled room

fields.name: door_type_metal
fields.description: The type of metal door

fields.name: inside_lux_light
fields.description: The recorded value at sampling time (power density)

fields.name: exposed_ductwork
fields.description: The amount of exposed ductwork in the room

fields.name: door_material
fields.description: The material the door is composed of

fields.name: adjacent_rooms
fields.description: List of rooms (room number, room name) immediately adjacent to the sampling room

fields.name: wall_thermal_mass
fields.description: The ability of the wall to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete or concrete block that is either exposed or covered only with paint

fields.name: ceiling_signs_of_watermold
fields.description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the ceiling

fields.name: window_status
fields.description: Defines whether the windows were open or closed during environmental testing

fields.name: door_location
fields.description: The relative location of the door in the room

fields.name: window_signs_of_watermold
fields.description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the window.

fields.name: window_type
fields.description: The type of windows

fields.name: window_material
fields.description: The type of material used to finish a window

fields.name: window_horizontal_position
fields.description: The horizontal position of the window on the wall

fields.name: room_condition
fields.description: The condition of the room at the time of sampling

fields.name: window_areasize
fields.description: The window's length and width

fields.name: sampling_floor
fields.description: The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located

fields.name: room_count
fields.description: The total count of rooms in the built structure including all room types

fields.name: average_daily_occupancy
fields.description: Daily average occupancy of room. Indicate the number of person(s) daily occupying the sampling room.

fields.name: floor_condition
fields.description: The physical condition of the floor at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas

fields.name: door_type_wood
fields.description: The type of wood door

fields.name: door_condition
fields.description: The physical condition of the door

fields.name: door_movement
fields.description: The type of movement of the door

fields.name: interior_wall_condition
fields.description: The physical condition of the wall at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas

fields.name: floor_signs_of_watermold
fields.description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew in a room

fields.name: ceiling_structure
fields.description: The construction format of the ceiling

fields.name: wall_texture
fields.description: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a wall surface

fields.name: floor_thermal_mass
fields.description: The ability of the floor to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations

fields.name: room_air_exchange_rate
fields.description: The rate at which outside air replaces indoor air in a given space

fields.name: bathroom_count
fields.description: The number of bathrooms in the building

fields.name: shading_device_signs_of_watermold
fields.description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the shading device

fields.name: window_covering
fields.description: The type of window covering

fields.name: ceiling_texture
fields.description: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a ceiling surface

fields.name: maximum_occupancy
fields.description: The maximum amount of people allowed in the indoor environment

fields.name: gender_of_restroom
fields.description: The gender type of the restroom

fields.name: ceiling_condition
fields.description: The physical condition of the ceiling at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas

fields.name: floor_structure
fields.description: Refers to the structural elements and subfloor upon which the finish flooring is installed

fields.name: rooms_that_share_a_wall_with_sampling_room
fields.description: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a wall with the sampling room

fields.name: wall_finish_material
fields.description: The material utilized to finish the outer most layer of the wall

fields.name: room_occupancy
fields.description: Count of room occupancy at time of sampling

fields.name: room_location_in_building
fields.description: The position of the room within the building

fields.name: floor_finish_material
fields.description: The floor covering type; the finished surface that is walked on

fields.name: room_window_count
fields.description: Number of windows in the room

fields.name: sampling_room_id_or_name
fields.description: Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction (fresh/frozen/other).

fields.name: height_carpet_fiber_mat
fields.description: The average carpet fiber height in the indoor environment

fields.name: ceiling_area
fields.description: The area of the ceiling space within the room

fields.name: heating_system_delivery_method
fields.description: The method by which the heat is delivered through the system

fields.name: room_sampling_position
fields.description: The horizontal sampling position in the room relative to architectural elements

fields.name: room_moisture_damage_or_mold_history
fields.description: The history of moisture damage or mold in the past 12 months. Number of events of moisture damage or mold observed

fields.name: door_signs_of_watermold
fields.description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a door

fields.name: room_net_area
fields.description: The net floor area of sampling room. Net area excludes wall thicknesses

fields.name: ceiling_thermal_mass
fields.description: The ability of the ceiling to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete that is exposed. A metal deck that supports a concrete slab will act thermally as long as it is exposed to room air flow

fields.name: rooms_that_share_a_door_with_sampling_room
fields.description: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a door with the sampling room

fields.name: orientations_of_exterior_window
fields.description: The compass direction the exterior window of the room is facing

fields.name: wall_location
fields.description: The relative location of the wall within the room

fields.name: room_volume
fields.description: Volume of sampling room

fields.name: door_type_composite
fields.description: The composite type of the door

fields.name: bedroom_count
fields.description: The number of bedrooms in the building

fields.name: wall_construction_type
fields.description: The building class of the wall defined by the composition of the building elements and fire-resistance rating.

fields.name: wall_signs_of_watermold
fields.description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a wall

fields.name: window_condition
fields.description: The physical condition of the window at the time of sampling

fields.name: escalator_count
fields.description: The number of escalators within the built structure

fields.name: cooling_system_identifier
fields.description: The cooling system identifier

fields.name: quadrant_position
fields.description: The quadrant position of the sampling room within the building

fields.name: number_of_pets
fields.description: The number of pets residing in the sampled space

fields.name: window_vertical_position
fields.description: The vertical position of the window on the wall

fields.name: fireplace_type
fields.description: A firebox with chimney

fields.name: heating_delivery_locations
fields.description: The location of heat delivery within the room

fields.name: ceiling_finish_material
fields.description: The type of material used to finish a ceiling

fields.name: door_type
fields.description: The type of door material

fields.name: number_of_houseplants
fields.description: The number of plant(s) in the sampling space

fields.name: floor_age
fields.description: The time period since instalment of the carpet or flooring

fields.name: rooms_connected_by_a_doorway
fields.description: List of rooms connected to the sampling room by a doorway

fields.name: specifications
fields.description: The building specifications. If design is chosen, indicate phase: conceptual, schematic, design development, construction documents

fields.name: specific_humidity
fields.description: The mass of water vapour in a unit mass of moist air, usually expressed as grams of vapour per kilogram of air, or, in air conditioning, as grains per pound.

fields.name: window_open_frequency
fields.description: The number of times windows are opened per week

fields.name: room_dimensions
fields.description: The length, width and height of sampling room

fields.name: water_feature_size
fields.description: The size of the water feature

fields.name: amount_or_size_of_sample_collected
fields.description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

fields.name: sample_size_sorting_method
fields.description: method by which samples are sorted

fields.name: organism_count
fields.description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

fields.name: mechanical_structure
fields.description: mechanical structure: a moving structure

fields.name: handidness
fields.description: The handidness of the individual sampled

fields.name: geographic_location_country_andor_sea
fields.description: The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
cv: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

fields.name: host_disease_status
fields.description: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

fields.name: host_scientific_name
fields.description: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

fields.name: relative_air_humidity
fields.description: partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air

fields.name: absolute_air_humidity
fields.description: actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture

fields.name: surface_humidity
fields.description: surface water activity as a function of air and material moisture

fields.name: air_temperature
fields.description: temperature of the air at time of sampling

fields.name: surface_temperature
fields.description: temperature of the surface at time of sampling

fields.name: surface_moisture
fields.description: water held on the surface

fields.name: surface_moisture_ph
fields.description: pH measurement of surface

fields.name: dew_point
fields.description: The temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

fields.name: last_time_sweptmoppedvacuumed
fields.description: The last time the floor was cleaned (swept, mopped, vacuumed)

fields.name: number_of_residents
fields.description: The number of individuals currently occupying in the sampling location

fields.name: average_dew_point
fields.description: The average of dew point measures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

fields.name: frequency_of_cleaning
fields.description: The number of times the sample location is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.

fields.name: carbon_dioxide
fields.description: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

fields.name: source_material_identifiers
fields.description: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

fields.name: seasonal_use
fields.description: The seasons the space is occupied

fields.name: season
fields.description: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).

fields.name: average_temperature
fields.description: The average of temperatures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

fields.name: host_specificity_or_range
fields.description: The range and diversity of host species that an organism is capable of infecting, defined by NCBI taxonomy identifier.

fields.name: perturbation
fields.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

fields.name: negative_control_type
fields.description: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

fields.name: positive_control_type
fields.description: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

fields.name: experimental_factor
fields.description: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

fields.name: encoded_traits
fields.description: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

fields.name: subspecific_genetic_lineage
fields.description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

fields.name: taxonomic_classification
fields.description: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes. Expected values are: classification method, database name, and other parameters e.g. vConTACT vContact2 (references from NCBI RefSeq v83, genus rank classification, default parameters)

fields.name: isolation_and_growth_condition
fields.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

fields.name: annotation_source
fields.description: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

fields.name: reference_for_biomaterial
fields.description: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

fields.name: sample_material_processing
fields.description: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

fields.name: sample_volume_or_weight_for_dna_extraction
fields.description: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

fields.name: nucleic_acid_extraction
fields.description: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

fields.name: nucleic_acid_amplification
fields.description: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

fields.name: library_size
fields.description: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

fields.name: library_reads_sequenced
fields.description: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

fields.name: library_construction_method
fields.description: Library construction method used for clone libraries

fields.name: library_vector
fields.description: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

fields.name: library_screening_strategy
fields.description: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

fields.name: pcr_conditions
fields.description: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

fields.name: pcr_primers
fields.description: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

fields.name: adapters
fields.description: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

fields.name: date_last_rain
fields.description: The date of the last time it rained

fields.name: sampling_day_weather
fields.description: The weather on the sampling day

fields.name: amount_of_light
fields.description: The unit of illuminance and luminous emittance, measuring luminous flux per unit area

fields.name: train_line
fields.description: The subway line name

fields.name: outside_relative_humidity
fields.description: The recorded outside relative humidity value at the time of sampling

fields.name: depth
fields.description: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
fields.regex: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)|(^missing$))

fields.name: door_area_or_size
fields.description: The size of the door

fields.name: visual_media
fields.description: The building visual media

fields.name: built_structure_setting
fields.description: The characterization of the location of the built structure as high or low human density

fields.name: built_structure_type
fields.description: A physical structure that is a body or assemblage of bodies in space to form a system capable of supporting loads

fields.name: exterior_door_count
fields.description: The number of exterior doors in the built structure

fields.name: design_construction_and_operation_documents
fields.description: The building design, construction and operation documents

fields.name: shading_device_condition
fields.description: The physical condition of the shading device at the time of sampling

fields.name: occupancy_documentation
fields.description: The type of documentation of occupancy

fields.name: floor_count
fields.description: The number of floors in the building, including basements and mechanical penthouse

fields.name: shading_device_material
fields.description: The material the shading device is composed of

fields.name: built_structure_age
fields.description: The age of the built structure since construction

fields.name: hallwaycorridor_count
fields.description: The total count of hallways and corridors in the built structure

fields.name: architectural_structure
fields.description: An architectural structure is a human-made, free-standing, immobile outdoor construction

fields.name: shading_device_type
fields.description: The type of shading device

fields.name: shading_device_location
fields.description: The location of the shading device in relation to the built structure

fields.name: drawings
fields.description: The buildings architectural drawings; if design is chosen, indicate phase-conceptual, schematic, design development, and construction documents

fields.name: address
fields.description: The street name and building number where the sampling occurred.

fields.name: room_architectural_elements
fields.description: The unique details and component parts that, together, form the architecture of a distinguishable space within a built structure

fields.name: aerospace_structure
fields.description: Aerospace structures typically consist of thin plates with stiffeners for the external surfaces, bulkheads and frames to support the shape and fasteners such as welds, rivets, screws and bolts to hold the components together
